alert.note: Alert for Johnston (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 4:55AM EST until further notice by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Raleigh NC has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in North Carolina... Neuse River Near Clayton affecting Johnston County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Neuse River near Clayton. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Minor flooding begins. Minor overflow occurs on both banks. Water reaches the edge of the Neuse River Greenway trail. At 10.0 feet, Upstream of the gage site, the Neuse River Greenway at Covered Bridge Road begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:15 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 8.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 8.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this morning to a crest of 9.9 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Sun Neuse River Clayton 9.0 8.4 Wed 4 am EST 4.6 2.6 2.2 2.0 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 500 PM EST.
